body: @patrickmckenna are you still working on this PR?
Huh? The test is unstable? I expected that comparing OrderedDicts would be stable.

> Would it be possible to add some tests to this PR as well?

In progress. I would lean to merge this first since the operator and some other functionality would rely on it. Local integration has been done

Can you also add the view.userDefinedFunctionResources[].resourceUri property?
Sweet, thanks @nykh
@ryanyuan Can you add more documentation in the docstring to say that if you want to create a view instead of the operator, pass a dictionary to `view`
I don't have time to do a full review of this PR now (sorry, very busy) but could you adjust the PR title to be more descriptive of what the change is -- the PR title is what ends up in the Changelog

Sorry about that, I thought that the commit messages were what went to the changelog.

I understand the instability. When scanning environment variables, the order in which the environment keys are found is not stable. I'll sort the environment keys before consuming them to make sure that the `getsection()` output is deterministic.
Huh, I don't know why it failed only in the `TOX_ENV=py27-backend_postgres-env_docker` env... is that normal or should I look into it?

> Sorry about that, I thought that the commit messages were what went to the changelog.

They do - but becasue of how we merge on Github the PR title is the "subject" of the commit message. A failure of a single test on one environment is usually a sign of a flaky test elsehwere :( I've triggered a re-run of it.

This seems a naive duplicate of https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3723

But I did some testing and I didn't observe that error.

Hmmm so the tests failed for 3 of the Py27 (docker) environments but passed for one (k8s) of them... ?

Not sure how to interpret this.

@kaxil, @criccomini, @davydov, hi guys! maybe somebody else can also review this PR? it's covered 3 tasks: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-571 (main), subsets: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-1592, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-1822 thank you in advance!
@Padarn this can be closed, another PR ~~#3251~~ #4188, fixed the issue
Hmm. I think I'll give up on this PR and just force update `tenacity` on my py37 environment, though I'll leave the JIRA issue open.
@Fokko do you still intend to see this PR through? Did you reproduce @r39132's error?
@villasv The K8s tests only executes a simple dag. This dag might not contain an operator that uses Tenacity. This is exactly the reason why we have the different test suites :-)
@villasv Currently I'm quite busy, feel free to pick this up if you like.

@ashb @yeluolei I just went through the pain of trying to use `scripts/ci/kubernetes` to test the kubernetes executor out locally, debugging it and finding this PR. Can we get this merged so no-one else has to go through this again?
@kaxil I rebased. Please check it.

Good one, thanks @noqcks

Ideally, this isn't anything that I would use. In my case I would:

- Don't store all the credentials in Airflow itself, but connect to an external credential system such as Google KMS, or Azure Keyvault, Hashicorp vault, etc.
- When provisioning a new Airflow instance, first deploy it, and then set all the credentials again programmatically. We don't want to manually enter all the credentials because that is a very brittle process. Therefore this should be automated. If you update you Fernet key, you could update your credentials as well.

What do you think?

* Agreed that it would be useful to integrate Airflow with external KMS options. But AWS/GCP/Azure KMS services don't store encrypted credentials--they store encryption keys. AWS Parameter Store and Hashicorp Vault do store secrets. Would you be interested in adding pluggable secret encryption and/or storage for Airflow 2.0? I'd be happy to contribute.
* I think it should be possible to rotate the Fernet key without updating all credentials. Ideally users can easily automate updating all credentials, but that might not be possible--for example, users might add credentials to Airflow manually, credentials might need to be pulled from many sources, etc. And in general, it's good practice to make it possible to easily rotate any cryptographic keys.

By the way, I also submitted #4232, which should make it easier to programmatically update credentials.
Noticed there were some merge conflicts in integration.rst since last week so I fixed that and pushed again

Swagger is now rebranded and re-badged as OpenAPI (Sometimes also called Swagger v3) so it would be nice to find a module supporting that:

https://smartbear.com/blog/develop/what-is-the-difference-between-swagger-and-openapi/
